intro: Nasturtium nitidum, commonly known as the glossy nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy green leaves that are often used in culinary applications. Its stems are hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Nasturtium nitidum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
